dublin_core.dcvalue: Historically the US military has utilized centralized store and forward SAndF telemedicine programs for health care providers in remote locations worldwide In the civilian community new methods and platforms for teledermatology have been created based largely on those used by the military to maximize access to and the efficiency of health care including secure direct to consumer DTC mobile applications for patients live interactive methods and integrated SAndF platforms for dermatology services within electronic health record EHR systems By incorporating similar innovative teledermatology methods and platforms the US military health care system may benefit from increased accessibility and productivity
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-08T14:14:02Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2-11-30
Teledermatology in the US military: a historic foundation for current and future applications.
